intro: Tittmannia erecta, commonly known as the upright tittmannia, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Melanthiaceae. It is native to the eastern United States, where it thrives in moist, shaded woodlands. The plant features slender, erect stems with narrow, lance-shaped leaves that are arranged alternately along the stem. Its flowers are small and greenish-white, clustered in loose umbels, and bloom in late spring. Tittmannia erecta is often found in association with other woodland flora and plays a role in supporting local insect populations.
